info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 25 at 4:53PM MDT by NWS GreatFalls
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southern Broadwater, northeastern Madison and north central Gallatin Counties through 530 PM MDT... At 448 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms from 7 miles west of Belgrade south to the border of central Madison and Gallatin Counties, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph, hail up to nickel size, and heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Damage to crops, siding on houses, and other outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bozeman, Belgrade, Three Forks, Manhattan, Bozeman Hot Springs, Gallatin Gateway, Missouri Headwaters State Park, Logan, Amsterdam, Four Corners, Trident, Church Hill, Menard and Madison Buffalo Jump State Park. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Heavy rainfall with the hail may lead to localized flooding, especially in poor drainage areas. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Accumulating hail on the roadways will also make travel very difficult. Drive with caution through these areas. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
